intro: Arctotis cernua, commonly known as the downy arctotis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and pink to red petals, blooming from late spring to early autumn. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and borders. Arctotis cernua is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
